intro: Oxypetalum glabrum var. macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its foliage is evergreen, with leathery leaves that provide year-round interest in the landscape.
